intro: Barnadesia flavescens, commonly known as the yellow barnadesia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. It typically grows in shrubland and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
